solution_line_template: Janice bought five juices for ${total_juice_cost}, so one juice costs {total_juice_cost} / {num_juices} = $<<{total_juice_cost}/{num_juices}={cost_per_juice}>>{cost_per_juice}.

She also bought two sandwiches for ${total_sandwich_cost}, so one sandwich costs {total_sandwich_cost} / {num_sandwiches} = $<<{total_sandwich_cost}/{num_sandwiches}={cost_per_sandwich}>>{cost_per_sandwich}.
So for one juice and one sandwich, Janice would need to pay {cost_per_juice} + {cost_per_sandwich} = $<<{cost_per_juice}+{cost_per_sandwich}={total_cost_one_of_each}>>{total_cost_one_of_each}.
